page.title: 18ECOLOGY 2. ENVIRONMENT.
page.content: "We grow wheat & barley, also potatoes & turnips. Recently, oil seed rape. My wife helps with the lambs", said David Coote, a labourer on Whins Farm, thus emphasizing the largely unchanged face of local farms, limited by the nature of the soil. Here small fields abound; the many hedgerows of hawthorn & dog- rose, which together with the several areas of woodland provide a much need- ed habitat for native flora & fauna. The mines have gone, &their ugly slag- heaps, improving considerably the land scape since Mitton. The air is purer & the vegetation taking on a more luxur- ious aspect. The rivers too, notwith- standing the industry at Newfield, are less polluted. The Wear, restocked, is now fished by local angling clubs. The villages, never pretty, are now cleaner; more colourful (see slide 3). Man & nature is benefiting from this.
